contentrichtext.text: The '''Opuha Dam''' is located on the [[Opuha River]], a tributary of the [[Opihi River]] in South [[Canterbury Region|Canterbury]], [[New Zealand]]. The dam is used for water storage for farming [[irrigation]] and provides 7.7 MW of electricity to [[New Zealand]]'s national grid. The site has been identified as an [[Important Bird Area]] by [[BirdLife International]] because it supports breeding colonies of the [[endangered species|endangered]] [[Black-billed Gull]].<ref name=bli>{{cite web |url= http://www.birdlife.org |title= Opuha Dam |accessdate=2012-11-15 |work= BirdLife data zone: Important Bird Areas |first= |last= |publisher= BirdLife International |date= 2012}}</ref> ==History== The dam failed during construction on 6 February 1997 due to heavy rain.<ref>Lees, P. & Thomson, D. (2003) [http://www.ipenz.org.nz/nzsold/2003Symposium/LargeDams2003pages84-104.pdf 'Emergency management, Opuha Dam collapse, Waitangi Day 1997'], NZ Society on Large Dams (NZSOLD), ''2003 Symposium "Dams – Consents and Current Practice”'', Papers. Part 1, pages 84–89. [[The Institution of Professional Engineers New Zealand]], PO Box 12-241, [[Wellington, New Zealand]], 2003.</ref> It was completed in 1998, creating [[Lake Opuha]].<ref>[http://www.rootsweb.ancestry.com/~nzlscant/opuha.htm Lake Opuha], South Canterbury, New Zealand.</ref> ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.ipenz.org.nz/nzsold/2003Symposium/LargeDams2003pages84-104.pdf IPENZ] report on emergency management. {{coord|44|00|02|S|170|53|28|E|region:NZ-CAN_type:landmark_source:dewiki|display=title}} [[Category:1998 establishments in New Zealand]] [[Category:Buildings and structures in the Canterbury Region]] [[Category:Dams in New Zealand]] [[Category:Irrigation in New Zealand]] [[Category:Dam disasters]] [[Category:1997 industrial disasters]] [[Category:Industrial accidents and incidents in New Zealand]] [[Category:1997 in New Zealand]]<!-- disaster --> [[Category:Dams completed in 1998]] [[Category:Important Bird Areas of New Zealand]] {{NewZealand-struct-stub}} {{Dam-stub}}
